resources.string:
Determinant of a 3 x 3 square matix is denoted by replacing the brackets by vertical bars and it is defined by the relation:
(a1b2c3 + a3b1c2 + a2b3c1)-(a3b2c1 + a1b3c2 + a2b1c3)
The determinant of a 2 x 2 matrix is defined by (ad - cb) which is the product of the elements on the principal diagonal minus the products of the elements on the secondary diagonals.
The determinant of a matrix A denoted by det A is a single number or algebraic expression that depends upon the elements of A or to replace the parenthesis by vertical bars.
